intro: Enriquebeltrania, commonly known as the "Mexican moonflower," is a rare and striking plant native to the Sierra Madre Occidental in Mexico. It is a flowering plant belonging to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), known for its large, white, fragrant blooms that open at night. The plant has a unique morphology, featuring showy, trumpet-shaped flowers and thick, waxy leaves adapted to arid conditions. Due to habitat loss, Enriquebeltrania is considered endangered, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival.
